channel.title: mozCC on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in mozCC on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: Building WebExtensions in Typescript
item.description: I spent yesterday evening doing something I haven’t done in a while: tinkering.

item.title: Web Progress Notifications in Fennec
item.description: Working on OpenAttribute for Firefox Mobile (Fennec) yesterday, one of the first challenges I faced was how to get notification that a page had finished loading.

item.title: Unexpected Attribution
item.description: I’m working on adding support for Firefox Mobile to OpenAttribute this weekend.

item.title: Minor update for OpenAttribute
item.description: I’ve just pushed a minor update to OpenAttribute to github .

item.title: Licenses & Attribution in Firefox: OpenAttribute
item.description: Seven years ago I started working on MozCC, an add-on for Firefox that exposed Creative Commons license information embedded in web pages.

item.title: MozCC Resources Moved
item.description: MozCC will be getting some much-needed attention this summer (wink, wink, nudge, nudge), so I took the opportunity to move the web content from my web server over to Creative Commons’ server.

item.title: mozCC on addons.mozilla.org
item.description: mozCC is now hosted over at addons.

item.title: mozCC updated, adds support for Flock
item.description: Yeah, an upgrade for mozCC .

item.title: mozCC Updates
item.description: So Hal pointed out that mozCC 1.

item.title: mozCC 1.1.3 for Firefox 1.5 Beta 2
item.description: Maybe it’s just the hacking environment here at the Summit, but I’ve been hella productive today.

item.title: MozCC with Firefox 1.5 Beta 2
item.description: Just a quick note to head off the stream of email I’ve been receiving (yes, both of them): mozCC doesn’t work with Firefox 1.

item.title: mozCC 1.1.2 Out
item.description: mozCC 1.

item.title: mozCC 1.1
item.description: mozCC 1.

item.title: Secrets
item.description: All Things Considered had a story yesterday on PostSecret , a web site which invites people to send in postcards with their deepest secrets, and have them posted online.

item.title: mozCC 0.9.9 Available
item.description: So I promised a new release of mozCC to users back in December.

item.title: Updating mozCC
item.description: I recently announced the release of mozCC 0.

item.title: mozCC Update
item.description: From the mozCC News page:

item.title: mozCC 0.8.3 released
item.description: (reposted from mozCC news )

item.title: The Importance of dot-slash
item.description: Sometimes it’s the little things.

item.title: The Road to 1.0
item.description: Now that I’m actually getting paid to work on mozCC , we’re starting to discuss what’s necessary to call it 1.

item.title: mozCC Updated
item.description: I’ve updated mozCC with some performance enhancements and bug fixes.

item.title: mozCC 0.8.0 Now Available
item.description: (duplicated from mozCC News )

item.title: mozCC 0.8.0 Preview
item.description: I’ve been working on a much-need update to mozCC , and wanted to give users a preview of what I’m working on.

item.title: mozCC 0.7.7 Now Available
item.description: The title says it all; see the release announcement here and find out how to install here .

item.title: mozCC on Slashdot
item.description: I guess my 15 minutes are here.

item.title: mozCC 0.7.5 out
item.description: Much later than I initially anticipated, mozCC 0.

item.title: CC RDF in JavaScript
item.description: It’s taking much longer than I’d like, but I’m slowly making progress on a new release of mozCC .

item.title: cascading problems
item.description: After a 3 week hiatus I’ve begun working on mozCC bugs again.

item.title: mozCC 0.7.0 Released
item.description: OK, mozCC 0.

item.title: Eating my own dogfood
item.description: At work my workstation runs Gentoo Linux .

item.title: mozCC CVS moved
item.description: I’ve finished moving the CVS repository from my server to mozCC.

item.title: Bug tracking and more for mozCC
item.description: While I was gone there were a handful of bug reports for mozCC (that I still haven’t gotten to).

item.title: Back in Indiana
item.description: I made it back to Indiana last night after an absolutely hellish day of travel.

item.title: mozCC for everyone!
item.description: Since announcing mozCC on Freshmeat yesterday the response has been amazing.

item.title: mozCC 0.6: The Integration Release
item.description: A little gift from me to you, mozCC 0.

item.title: mozCC 0.5.3 Update
item.description: I’ve released another incremental upgrade to mozCC.

item.title: mozCC 0.5.1 Update
item.description: I’ve built a new XPI for MozCC which incorporates fixes for some of the bugs reported to me last week.

item.title: mozCC 0.5 Now Available
item.description: Testers, start your engines.

item.title: A Mostly Functional mozCC
item.description: Really, I’m as amazed as anyone else.

item.title: mozCC progress report
item.description: So, a status report on mozCC.

item.title: The Battle Continues
item.description: So the battle to create a Gecko extension continues.

item.title: The Gecko Wars, continued
item.description: In an object lesson on why OpenSource is important, I finally figured out how to listen for navigation events in a Mozilla Firebird extension.

item.title: Grokking the Lizard
item.description: So I spent most of my morning on Friday attempting to grok the state of Mozilla/Firebird/Gecko plugin development.
